Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
rytov - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

Help.Tip: Choose the type of migration. RYTOV or SS(SPLIT STEP).
Help.Text:
rytov - METHOD
Choose the type of migration. RYTOV or SS(SPLIT STEP).
 
 Default = RYTOV
 Allowed = RYTOV
 Allowed = SS
 Allowed = RYTOVI
 Allowed = SSI
 The rytov ans split step algorithms are supported, as well as impulse
 response modeling with these two algorithms.

Help.Tip: Choose YES to restart a job
Help.Text:
rytov - RESTART
Choose YES to restart a job
 
 Default = NO
 Allowed =
 Jobs that ended prematurely can be restarted. A restart job will
 read in the old image file and start with the next profile in
 the imaging sequence

Help.Tip: None
Help.Text:
rytov - RMIMAGES
None
 
 Default = YES
 Allowed =
 Rmeove the image checkpoint files when done

Help.Tip: The velocity model file.
Help.Text:
rytov - SELECT_PATH_VEL
The velocity model file.
 
 Default = NONE   ! this is the default value from a list of options.
 Allowed = char(120)
 A file containing velocity data.

Help.Tip: The velocity model file.
Help.Text:
rytov - PATH_VEL
The velocity model file.
 
 Default = NONE   ! this is the default value from a list of options.
 Allowed = char(120)
 A file containing velocity data.

Help.Tip: A base name for the output image file.
Help.Text:
rytov - SELECT_PATH_IMG
A base name for the output image file.
 
 Default = NONE ! this is the default value from a list of options.
 Allowed = char(120)
 A base name to be used for checkpointing image data.
 A cpu dependent extension will be added to this name.

Help.Tip: A base name for the output image file.
Help.Text:
rytov - PATH_IMG
A base name for the output image file.
 
 Default = NONE ! this is the default value from a list of options.
 Allowed = char(120)
 A base name to be used for checkpointing image data.
 A cpu dependent extension will be added to this name.

Help.Tip: The seimic input data.
Help.Text:
rytov - PATH_DAT
The seimic input data.
 
 Default = NONE   ! this is the default value from a list of options.
 Allowed = char(120)
 A file containing velocity data.

Help.Tip: The source wavelet file .
Help.Text:
rytov - PATH_SRC
The source wavelet file .
 
 Default = NONE   ! this is the default value from a list of options.
 Allowed = char(120)
 A file containing a source wavelet trace.

Help.Tip: The first shot profile to image.
Help.Text:
rytov - SHOT1ST
The first shot profile to image.
 
 Default = 1   ! this is the default value from a list of options.
 Allowed = >0
 The first shot profile to image.

Help.Tip: The last shot profile to image.
Help.Text:
rytov - SHOTEND
The last shot profile to image.
 
 Default = 99999
 Allowed = >0
 The last shot profile to image.

Help.Tip: Image every shotinc'th shot profile.
Help.Text:
rytov - SHOTINC
Image every shotinc'th shot profile.
 
 Default = 1   ! this is the default value from a list of options.
 Allowed = >0
 A skip parameter for imageing shot profiles. You will image
 shot1st, shot1st+shotinc, shot1st+2*shotinc, etc.

Help.Tip: The maximum expected size of a shot profile.
Help.Text:
rytov - SHOTSIZ
The maximum expected size of a shot profile.
 
 Default = 240   ! this is the default value from a list of options.
 Allowed = >0
 The maximum expected size of a shot profile.

Help.Tip: Choose the source wavelet type
Help.Text:
rytov - SRC_TYPE
Choose the source wavelet type
 
 Default = RICKER   ! this is the default value from a list of options.
 Allowed = RICKER
 Allowed = GAUSS
 Allowed = FILE
 Allowed = NONE
 If SRC_TYPE=FILE, the source wavelet will be read from PATH_SRC.
 IF SRC_TYPE=NONE, a post stack migration is assumed.

Help.Tip: Choose the source wavelet center greq when type=RICKER or GAUSS
Help.Text:
rytov - SRC_FREQ
Choose the source wavelet center greq when type=RICKER or GAUSS
 
 Default = 15.0
 Allowed = > 0
 Center frequency of analytic source wavelets

Help.Tip: Choose the source wavelet depth location
Help.Text:
rytov - SRC_ZLOC
Choose the source wavelet depth location
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed =
 Source depth = src_zloc * source_center_wavelength
              = src_zloc * C0 / src_freq
 Best to locate the source at a grid location.

Help.Tip: Choose the source wavelet center freq when type=RICKER or GAUSS
Help.Text:
rytov - SRC_AMPL
Choose the source wavelet center freq when type=RICKER or GAUSS
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed =
 Amplitude scalar for the source.

Help.Tip: Choose the source wavelet time delay
Help.Text:
rytov - SRC_TDEL
Choose the source wavelet time delay
 
 Default = 0.0666
 Allowed =
 Time delay the source wavelet. A reasonable value is 1/src_freq.

Help.Tip: Minimum frequency in herz
Help.Text:
rytov - FREQ_MIN
Minimum frequency in herz
 
 Default = 1.0
 Allowed =
 Minimum frequency

Help.Tip: Maximum frequency in herz
Help.Text:
rytov - FREQ_MAX
Maximum frequency in herz
 
 Default = 45.0
 Allowed =
 Maximim frequency

Help.Tip: grid step control
Help.Text:
rytov - BETA
grid step control
 
 Default = 0.2
 Allowed = 0.1 - 1.0
 Substeps the downward continution step size

Help.Tip: Dip limit in degrees
Help.Text:
rytov - THETA
Dip limit in degrees
 
 Default = 60.0
 Allowed =
 A parameter for dip limitation

Help.Tip: Header word to use for binning data.
Help.Text:
rytov - FAST_HDR
Header word to use for binning data.
 
 Default = 17
 Allowed =
 Header word to use for binning data.

Help.Tip: Header word to use for binning data.
Help.Text:
rytov - SLOW_HDR
Header word to use for binning data.
 
 Default = 18
 Allowed =
 Header word to use for binning data.

Help.Tip: Computational grid count in X direction
Help.Text:
rytov - X_TOT
Computational grid count in X direction
 
 Default = 1024
 Allowed =
 Helpless

Help.Tip: Computational grid count in Y direction
Help.Text:
rytov - Y_TOT
Computational grid count in Y direction
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed =
 Helpless

Help.Tip: Computational grid count in Z direction
Help.Text:
rytov - Z_TOT
Computational grid count in Z direction
 
 Default = 501
 Allowed =
 Helpless

Help.Tip: Computational grid origin in X direction
Help.Text:
rytov - X_ORG
Computational grid origin in X direction
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed =
 Helpless

Help.Tip: Computational grid origin in Y direction
Help.Text:
rytov - Y_ORG
Computational grid origin in Y direction
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed =
 Helpless

Help.Tip: Computational grid origin in Z direction
Help.Text:
rytov - Z_ORG
Computational grid origin in Z direction
 
 Default = 0.0
 Allowed =
 Helpless

Help.Tip: Computational grid size in X direction
Help.Text:
rytov - X_INC
Computational grid size in X direction
 
 Default = 10.0
 Allowed =
 Helpless

Help.Tip: Computational grid size in Y direction
Help.Text:
rytov - Y_INC
Computational grid size in Y direction
 
 Default = 10.0
 Allowed =
 Helpless

Help.Tip: Computational grid size in Z direction
Help.Text:
rytov - Z_INC
Computational grid size in Z direction
 
 Default = 5.0
 Allowed =
 Helpless

Help.Tip: The size of the imaging window in the X direction.
Help.Text:
rytov - X_TOT_IMG
The size of the imaging window in the X direction.
 
 Default = 1024
 Allowed =
 All shot images are summed into a window of size X_TOT_IMG.
 Individual shots are imaged into a window of size X_TOT.
 The shot window is a sliding window within the X_TOT_IMG window,
 which represents the overall image and model.

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
rytov - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
rytov - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
rytov - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
rytov - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
rytov - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
rytov - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
rytov - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
rytov - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
rytov - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
rytov - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
rytov - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : RYTOV
 Category   : migrations
 Written    : 2001-01-16   by: R.S.Day
 Revised    : 2006-12-04   by: D. Glover
 Maturity   : production
 Purpose    : Migration of pre stack shot data via the Rytov algorithm.
 Portability: No known limitations.
 Parallel   : No
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
 
 This process can perform either a 2D pre-stack shot profile depth migration,
 or a post-stack 2D depth migration. The depth migration algorithm operates by
 downward continuing data in the frequency domain. If the velocity model has
 no lateral changes, then the algorithm reverts to the classic phase shift
 migration. If there are lateral velocity changes in the model, there are
 additional ffts between X and Kx to correct for the effect of the lateral
 velocity changes. The theory involved is in the papers of Huang et al.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          ADVICE FOR USERS
 
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                             REVISION HISTORY
 
     Date        Author     Description
     ----        ------     -----------
 11. 2006-12-04  D. Glover  Added NULLIFY statements for Intel compiler.
 10. 2006-06-15  Goodger    Remove unused variables.
  9. 2006-06-12  Goodger    Change sizeof(data(1,1) to sizeof(d3) in routine
                            image_wrstk to make absoft 9.0 compiler happy.
  6. 2002-02-04  R.S.Day    Changes for new modgrid_data_stats prototype
  5. 2001-10-17  R.S.Day    Eliminated obsolete features to make ifc
                            compiler happy
  4. 2001-08-07  R.S.Day    Added pathchoose primitive on the GUI. Argument
                            change for rytov_prim_create and
                            rytov_prim_initialize. Corrected amplitudes so the
                            it is consistent with cazmig. Changed rytov_elr
                            to rytov_extrpolate. Added call to rytov_print_par
                            Corrected bug in rytov_butterworth. Min frequency
                            clip made consistent with cazmig. Added call
                            cazmig_comp_ref to compute reference velocity.
                            rytov_scan_shot changed to rytov_scan_group.
  3. 2001-06-05  R.S.Day    Added rytov_prim_create, rytov_prim_initialize for
                            calls from cazmig. Added variable tw_sign to
                            control the fft sign conventions. Can be called
                            by cazmig to perform 3D post stack migration.
                            Added rytov_comp_ref, rytov_perturb.
  2. 2001-05-03  R.S.Day    Modified portions of the program to handle 3D
                            data. Will do post stack migration if source type
                            is set to NONE. real-complex FFTs replaced
                            complex-complex transforms for the t-w
                            transform. Replaced x to kx transforms with x-y to
                            kx-ky 2D transforms. Eliminated use of the velgrid
                            module, and use modgrid now. Many-many changes!
  1. 2001-01-16  R.S.Day    Initial version.
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
